name: Rainbow Trout (Redband)
description: The Deschutes River is famous for its native redband rainbow trout, a subspecies uniquely adapted to the high desert environment. These fish are known for their fighting spirit and beautiful red stripe along their sides.

name: Brown Trout
description: Brown trout were introduced to Central Oregon waters and have thrived. They are typically found in deeper pools and are known for being wary and selective, making them a rewarding catch for experienced anglers.

name: Cutthroat Trout
description: Native cutthroat trout are found in tributaries and headwaters of the Deschutes system. They are easily identified by the red slash under their jaw. Less common than rainbows but highly prized.

name: Brook Trout
description: Actually a char, brook trout thrive in cold, high-elevation lakes and streams. They are beautifully colored with light spots on a dark background and orange fins. Popular in the Cascade Lakes.

name: Bull Trout
description: Bull trout are a threatened species and must be released immediately if caught. They are the largest trout species in Oregon and are found in cold, clean waters. Identifying them correctly is crucial.

name: Kokanee Salmon (Landlocked Sockeye)
description: Kokanee are landlocked sockeye salmon that provide excellent fishing in Central Oregon reservoirs. They fight hard and are excellent eating. Popular in Wickiup and Crane Prairie reservoirs.

name: Chinook Salmon (King Salmon)
description: The Deschutes River sees both spring and fall runs of Chinook salmon. Spring runs (6-14 lbs) enter the river in spring, while fall runs (10-30+ lbs) arrive later in the season. Highly prized gamefish.

name: Mountain Whitefish
description: Whitefish are abundant in Central Oregon rivers and provide consistent action. They're often overlooked by trout anglers but fight well and are fun to catch, especially on nymphs.

name: Smallmouth Bass
description: Smallmouth bass are found in several Central Oregon reservoirs and the lower Deschutes River. They're aggressive fighters and provide exciting topwater action in warm months.

name: Largemouth Bass
description: Largemouth bass are found in several Cascade Lakes and ponds. They're the largest of the black bass species and provide exciting fishing, especially in weedy areas and around structure.

name: Steelhead (Sea-run Rainbow Trout)
description: Steelhead are anadromous rainbow trout that return from the ocean to freshwater. The Lower Deschutes has excellent summer steelhead fishing starting in August. These fish fight incredibly hard.
